trans-unit.source: Setting Up the Azure Import/Export Tool
trans-unit.target: Setting Up the Azure Import/Export Tool

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool is the drive preparation and repair tool that you can use with the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool is the drive preparation and repair tool that you can use with the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Service.

trans-unit.source: You can use the tool for the following functions:
trans-unit.target: You can use the tool for the following functions:

trans-unit.source: Before creating an import job, you can use this tool to copy data to the hard drives you are going to ship to a Windows Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: Before creating an import job, you can use this tool to copy data to the hard drives you are going to ship to a Windows Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: After an import job has completed, you can use this tool to repair any blobs that were corrupted, were missing, or conflicted with other blobs.
trans-unit.target: After an import job has completed, you can use this tool to repair any blobs that were corrupted, were missing, or conflicted with other blobs.

trans-unit.source: After you receive the drives from a completed export job, you can use this tool to repair any files that were corrupted or missing on the drives.
trans-unit.target: After you receive the drives from a completed export job, you can use this tool to repair any files that were corrupted or missing on the drives.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: If you are preparing drives for an import job, you will need to meet the following prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: If you are preparing drives for an import job, you will need to meet the following prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: You must have an active Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: You must have an active Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Your subscription must include a storage account with enough available space to store the files you are going to import.
trans-unit.target: Your subscription must include a storage account with enough available space to store the files you are going to import.

trans-unit.source: You need at least one of the account keys for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: You need at least one of the account keys for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: You need a computer (the "copy machine") with Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, or a newer Windows operating system installed.
trans-unit.target: You need a computer (the "copy machine") with Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, or a newer Windows operating system installed.

trans-unit.source: The .NET Framework 4 must be installed on the copy machine.
trans-unit.target: The .NET Framework 4 must be installed on the copy machine.

trans-unit.source: BitLocker must be enabled on the copy machine.
trans-unit.target: BitLocker must be enabled on the copy machine.

trans-unit.source: You will need one or more empty 3.5-inch SATA hard drives connected to the copy machine.
trans-unit.target: You will need one or more empty 3.5-inch SATA hard drives connected to the copy machine.

trans-unit.source: The files you plan to import must be accessible from the copy machine, whether they are on a network share or a local hard drive.
trans-unit.target: The files you plan to import must be accessible from the copy machine, whether they are on a network share or a local hard drive.

trans-unit.source: If you are attempting to repair an import that has partially failed, you will need:
trans-unit.target: If you are attempting to repair an import that has partially failed, you will need:

trans-unit.source: The copy log files
trans-unit.target: The copy log files

trans-unit.source: The storage account key
trans-unit.target: The storage account key

trans-unit.source: If you are attempting to repair an export that has partially failed, you will need:
trans-unit.target: If you are attempting to repair an export that has partially failed, you will need:

trans-unit.source: The copy log files
trans-unit.target: The copy log files

trans-unit.source: The manifest files (optional)
trans-unit.target: The manifest files (optional)

trans-unit.source: The storage account key
trans-unit.target: The storage account key

trans-unit.source: Installing the Azure Import/Export Tool
trans-unit.target: Installing the Azure Import/Export Tool

trans-unit.source: The Azure Import/Export tool consists of the following files:
trans-unit.target: The Azure Import/Export tool consists of the following files:

trans-unit.source: WAImportExport.exe
trans-unit.target: WAImportExport.exe

trans-unit.source: WAImportExport.exe.config
trans-unit.target: WAImportExport.exe.config

trans-unit.source: WAImportExportCore.dll
trans-unit.target: WAImportExportCore.dll

trans-unit.source: WAImportExportRepair.dll
trans-unit.target: WAImportExportRepair.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.dll

trans-unit.source: Hddid.dll
trans-unit.target: Hddid.dll

trans-unit.source: Copy these files to a working directory, for example, <codeInline>c:\WAImportExport</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Copy these files to a working directory, for example, <codeInline>c:\WAImportExport</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Next, open a command line window in Administrator mode, and set the above directory as current directory.
trans-unit.target: Next, open a command line window in Administrator mode, and set the above directory as current directory.

trans-unit.source: To output help for the command, run the tool without parameters:
trans-unit.target: To output help for the command, run the tool without parameters:
